name: Paginate

aliases.name: FetchResponse
aliases.comment:
The result type of a Paginated Fetch Request. At the minimum, your API
needs to return the items & a total count of all items.

If any additional data is returned that you would like to have access to, you
can decode it to the `extraData` field and use `getResponseData` to pull it
out of a `Paginated`.
aliases.type: { items : List a, totalCount : Int, extraData : Maybe.Maybe c }

types.name: Config
types.comment:
The `Config` type is used to build a Fetch Request, given the Paginated's
Request Data, a Page Number, & the Items per Page.

types.name: Msg
types.comment: Wrap an Http Response for a Page, to be handled in the `update` function.

types.name: Paginated
types.comment:
The `Paginated` type is responsible for storing the fetched items, current
page number, total count, and additional data to pass to the fetch command..

The `a` type refers to the data that is paginated, `b` refers to any additional
data you need to make the API request, and `c` is any additional data you want
to pull out of the API response.

values.name: bootstrapPager
values.comment:
Render a split Pager with the standard Bootstrap4 classes.

It takes a function that takes a page number & generates attributes for an
item's `a` element, the number of pages to show at the ends of the pagination,
the number of middle pages to show in the middles of the pagination, and a
pagination.

It will split out a list of `li` elements for each page that should be shown,
with disabled dots(`...`) between each section. A list is returned so that you
can add previous/next buttons if you want them.

See the docs for `getPagerSections` to see how the splitting works.
values.type: (Int -> List (Html.Attribute msg)) -> Int -> Int -> Paginate.Paginated a b c -> List (Html.Html msg)

values.name: getCurrent
values.comment: Get the current list of items.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> List a

values.name: getError
values.comment: Return the current page's fetch request's error if it has one.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Maybe.Maybe Http.Error

values.name: getPage
values.comment: Get the current page number.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Int

values.name: getPagerSections
values.comment:
Generate sections of pages to show for a Pager. Depending on the current
page & total number of pages, the sections may either be a single section, a
beginning & end section, or a beginning, middle, & end section.

Each section's page is a tuple of `(pageNumber, isCurrentPage)`.

The sections are defined by the initial arguments, the first is the number of
pages to show at the end sections, while the second is the number of pages to
show around the current page if it is in the middle section.

Some example of Pagers generated with 2 end & middle pages, with the current
page marked by `*`:

    *1*|2|3|4|5|6

    *1*|2|3|4|5|...|49|50

    1|2|3|4|*5*|...|49|50

    1|2|...|4|5|*6*|7|8|...|49|50

    1|2|...|9|10|*11*|12|13|...|49|50

    1|2|...|*46*|47|48|49|50

No split is made if there are not enough pages to show a middle section. When
at an end section, enough pages are shown that there must be something hidden
before splitting off the middle section.
values.type: Int -> Int -> Paginate.Paginated a b c -> List (List ( Int, Bool ))

values.name: getPerPage
values.comment: Get the number of items to show per page.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Int

values.name: getRemoteData
values.comment: Return the raw `WebData` for the current page.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> RemoteData.WebData (List a)

values.name: getRequestData
values.comment: Return the Extra Request Data for the current Paginated.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> b

values.name: getResponseData
values.comment: Return any Extra Response Data for the current Paginated.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Maybe.Maybe c

values.name: getTotalItems
values.comment: Get the total item count.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Int

values.name: getTotalPages
values.comment: Get the total number of pages.
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Int

values.name: hasNext
values.comment: Are there page's after the current one?
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Bool

values.name: hasNone
values.comment: Did the current page load successfully but return no items?
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Bool

values.name: hasPrevious
values.comment: Are there page's before the current one?
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Bool

values.name: initial
values.comment:
Get an initial Pagination & Fetch Commands from a `Config`, list of Filters,
& Page Number.
values.type: Paginate.Config a b c -> b -> Int -> Int -> ( Paginate.Paginated a b c, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Paginate.Msg a c) )

values.name: isFirst
values.comment: Is the current page the first page?
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Bool

values.name: isLast
values.comment: Is the current page the last page?
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Bool

values.name: isLoading
values.comment: Is the current page's fetch request still loading?
values.type: Paginate.Paginated a b c -> Bool

values.name: jumpTo
values.comment: Move to a specific page.
values.type: Paginate.Config a b c -> Int -> Paginate.Paginated a b c -> ( Paginate.Paginated a b c, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Paginate.Msg a c) )

values.name: makeConfig
values.comment: Make a `Config` from a function that takes a list of Parameters & a Page Number.
values.type: (b -> Int -> Int -> Http.Request (Paginate.FetchResponse a c)) -> Paginate.Config a b c

values.name: moveNext
values.comment:
Move to the next page.
TODO: re-implement as call to `jumpTo`?
values.type: Paginate.Config a b c -> Paginate.Paginated a b c -> ( Paginate.Paginated a b c, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Paginate.Msg a c) )

values.name: movePrevious
values.comment:
Move to the previous page.
TODO: re-implement as call to `jumpTo`?
values.type: Paginate.Config a b c -> Paginate.Paginated a b c -> ( Paginate.Paginated a b c, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Paginate.Msg a c) )

values.name: update
values.comment:
Update the Paginated Model on Fetch Completion.

If the Page Number of the Returned Model is Different than the Given Model,
We Were On a Page That Didn't Exist, So We Changed to the Last Page.

You Should Handle this Special Case in your Update Function, so that You can
Modify the Page URL.
values.type: Paginate.Config a b c -> Paginate.Msg a c -> Paginate.Paginated a b c -> ( Paginate.Paginated a b c, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Paginate.Msg a c) )

values.name: updateData
values.comment:
Replace the current Extra Request Data, jumping to page 1 & performing new
fetch requests. Does nothing if the Data is equal to existing Data.
values.type: Paginate.Config a b c -> b -> Paginate.Paginated a b c -> ( Paginate.Paginated a b c, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Paginate.Msg a c) )

values.name: updatePerPage
values.comment:
Update the items per page, jumping to page 1 & performing new fetch
requests. Does nothing if the new value is the same as the current items per
page.
values.type: Paginate.Config a b c -> Int -> Paginate.Paginated a b c -> ( Paginate.Paginated a b c, Platform.Cmd.Cmd (Paginate.Msg a c) )
